summary: This is an email chain from October 2019 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing a request to estimate the number of human trafficking victim interviews conducted in the past year. The email notes that the number is heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit
persons.context: The sender of the initial request for information on victim interviews, identifying themselves with their title and unit.

events.title: Request for Victim Interview Statistics
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney requests an estimate of how many unique victims or potential victims of human trafficking each unit has interviewed in the past year, noting the number is heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated October 4, 2019.
It contains a request for an estimate of human trafficking victim interviews conducted in the past year, with a note that the number is 'heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.'
The rough estimate provided for 2019 is 'roughly 30 such victim interviews.'
The correspondence highlights the ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case within the SDNY in late 2019.
The email chain shows coordination within the Human Trafficking and Money Laundering units regarding victim interview volumes.
